channel.title: Tweets on Jiayee.net

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (14 Oct 2020)
item.description: What expression do you overuse? I overuse way too many expressions. One of them being “nani”. I’m boring.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (13 Oct 2020)
item.description: You have no patience for ________________. People who do not get to the point.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (12 Oct 2020)
item.description: One word for today. Fresh.

item.title: Seedly
item.description: Spent my Sunday evening giving back to the Seedly community.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (11 Oct 2020)
item.description: What makes you feel wonderful? Freedom to do what I want.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (10 Oct 2020)
item.description: Write down the name of someone you had a good conservation with recently. My parents and my husband.

item.title: Fixed my writing
item.description: Grammarly and Hemingway were a huge help! Thank you!

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (09 Oct 2020)
item.description: You want a new ________________. Mindset.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (08 Oct 2020)
item.description: What is your biggest dream? Freedom.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (07 Oct 2020)
item.description: Are you happy with your choices today? I’m still on the fence! (Root cause)

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (06 Oct 2020)
item.description: Do you have any new friends? In a few minutes, if all goes well, yes! I’m joining my office’s “Random Lunch Connect” today and on Friday.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (05 Oct 2020)
item.description: What question makes you anxious? “How’s your progress?”

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (04 Oct 2020)
item.description: In three words, describe your love life. I am undeserving.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (03 Oct 2020)
item.description: What was the last bad movie you watched? I usually like the movies I watch.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (02 Oct 2020)
item.description: What do you crave? Motivation.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (01 Oct 2020)
item.description: What are you a geek about? Japanese singers and voice actors!

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (30 Sep 2020)
item.description: How do you get out of a rut? A “rut” is “a habit or pattern of behaviour that has become dull and unproductive but is hard to change”. (Oxford Languages). Start small. Materialise the plan for your adjustments (e.g. make a planning sheet). Maintain regularity and discipline on these small adjustments until you are comfortable. Always be conscious and bring yourself back whenever you find yourself losing discipline. Make further adjustments.

item.title: docker system prune -a --volumes
item.description: I’ve finally encountered this on my MacBook Air: no space left on device. And… docker system prune -a --volumes to the rescue! (Relevant Stack Overflow thread)

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (29 Sep 2020)
item.description: Bad news: Sugarcoated or straight-up? Please always cut to the chase.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (28 Sep 2020)
item.description: How hungry are you right now? I’m like 55% full now. Had a cup of water and a red apple when I woke up. Then, I exercised, showered, drank a cup of water and had a green apple. And a moment ago, I ate my in-laws’ peanut pancakes from yesterday, and I drank another cup of water. Should get more water plus a cup of milk. I’m all set for the day!

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (27 Sep 2020)
item.description: Do you handle rejection well? Usually, no, and that’s why it’s so easy for me to get so miserable. I wish I can handle rejection well.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (26 Sep 2020)
item.description: Today was amusing because ________________. Because I’ll be catching up with my CS3217 team and I should be in for some GOSSIP! Just kidding.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (25 Sep 2020)
item.description: Do you plan, or are you flying by the seat of your pants? To “fly by the seat of your pants” means to do something difficult without the necessary skill or experience (Cambridge Dictionary). I’m doing things which I have the necessary skills for but lack experience and exposure, does that count?

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (24 Sep 2020)
item.description: When was the last time you went dancing? If you consider the random movement of limbs as dancing, then it would be during the Indeed Holiday Party last year.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (23 Sep 2020)
item.description: Write down a quote for today. “When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.” - Sherlock Holmes.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (22 Sep 2020)
item.description: What shocking news have you recently learnt? It’s got to be the fact that “Yashahime: Princess Half-Demon” is coming soon! Picture from zerochan and “Yashahime: Princess Half-Demon” Wiki

item.title: Rendering newlines in HTML attributes
item.description: Doing <textarea placeholder="line1\nline2"> will not work, but doing <textarea placeholder="{{ somethingFromScope }}"> where somethingFromScope is line1\nline2 will work as expected!

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (21 Sep 2020)
item.description: Where do you think your road is going? Happiness, I hope.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (20 Sep 2020)
item.description: What’s your favourite television show? For now, it has to be “Angels of Death”. Picture from manga.tokyo and “Angels of Death” Wiki

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (19 Sep 2020)
item.description: What’s a new place you’ve recently been to? The Decathlon store nearby. Got some sportswear for my dad. Hope he likes them.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (18 Sep 2020)
item.description: A decision you made today? I decided to spend my Indeed “You” day today to create a theme for this website! Yay~

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (17 Sep 2020)
item.description: What’s your favourite snack food? POTATO CHIPS. Haven’t had them in a while… T_T

item.title: Markdown nested lists
item.description: Got too used to using 2-space indents (for JavaScript). Markdown nested lists need 4-space indents.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (16 Sep 2020)
item.description: What would you want to study at school? Math.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (15 Sep 2020)
item.description: Who are the most important people in your life? Family and friends (not just any friend and certainly not acquaintances). A real friend doesn’t have to be one whom I interact with every living moment. But he/she has to be someone I click with and someone who is/was there for me. Now, if only they thought the same of me.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (14 Sep 2020)
item.description: Who can help you? Myself.

item.title: Rule: no-var-requires
item.description: My pre-commit hook complained because the original code had an import that looked like var module = require("module"). The permitted ways to import are: import foo = require('foo') and “ES2015-style imports” which (I think) is defined in this part of the MDN web docs. I wonder when this rule was inserted…

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (13 Sep 2020)
item.description: Write down a minor but chronic problem. This one’s a secret.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (12 Sep 2020)
item.description: What are you chasing at this moment? Anime?

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (11 Sep 2020)
item.description: What advice would you give to a second-grader? Quit getting glued to your phone.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (10 Sep 2020)
item.description: This is utterly confounding: ________________ When supposedly clever people do stupid things.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (09 Sep 2020)
item.description: What comes to mind when you think of fear? Losing my job.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (08 Sep 2020)
item.description: Who are you jealous of? People who aren’t jealous of others.

item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (07 Sep 2020)
item.description: What’s the newest thing you’re wearing today? My wedding ring.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: ハロー・ワルド

item.title: Purge
item.description: I also purged my redux-persist storage and wondered how the heck did the frontend state remain intact.
